meanings.definition: The lean end of a neck of veal or mutton.
meanings.sent1: The chef trimmed the scrag off the mutton before roasting it.
meanings.sent2: The butcher removed the scrag from the veal to prepare the dish.
meanings.sent3: The scrag of the mutton decided to go on a diet to become less lean.
meanings.sent4: The scrag of the veal was so thin, it looked like a delicate ribbon.
meanings.sent5: The scrag of the mutton was so lean, it seemed almost transparent.

meanings.definition: A thin, scrawny person or animal.
meanings.sent1: The scrag of a cat wandered around the neighborhood looking for food.
meanings.sent2: The scrag in the shelter was adopted by a kind family.
meanings.sent3: The scrag of a dog tried to chase a squirrel but couldn't keep up.
meanings.sent4: The scrag of a bird perched on the branch, looking fragile and delicate.
meanings.sent5: The scrag of a rabbit hopped slowly across the field, its ribs visible.

meanings.definition: To wring the neck of; strangle.
meanings.sent1: The villain attempted to scrag the hero but was stopped in time.
meanings.sent2: The hunter knew how to scrag the prey swiftly and silently.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy spy accidentally tried to scrag the wrong person.
meanings.sent4: In the movie, the evil wizard used dark magic to scrag his enemies.
meanings.sent5: The old legend told of a ghostly figure that would scrag those who trespassed.
